description: Phase that enables an operator to check in materials defined in the Bill of Materials (BOM). Displays runtime instructions and a grid of materials flagged for check-in, allowing the operator to select lines, permit overage, enforce minimum quantities, and specify no‚Äêquantity options.
intent: To verify and record the check-in of required BOM materials into the unit procedure according to author-defined flags before production steps proceed.

inputs.Instructions: Instruction text displayed to the operator at runtime.
inputs.MaterialsGrid: List of BOM materials with columns for BOM Reference Number, Allow Overage Flag, Material ID, Check-In Flag, No Quantity Flag and Material Description.
inputs.SelectToCheckInFlags: Boolean flags indicating which material rows are selected for check-in.
inputs.AllowOverageFlags: Boolean flags indicating if overage is allowed for each selected material.
inputs.RequireMinimumFlags: Boolean flags indicating if the minimum required quantity must be checked in before completion.
inputs.NoQuantityFlags: Boolean flags indicating if the material lot will be checked in as empty.
inputs.ConfirmationType: Level of signature/confirmation required when finishing the phase (None, Single, Double).

outputs.CheckedInMaterials: List of material IDs (and quantities, if applicable) that were successfully checked in.
outputs.ExceptionsRecorded: Details of any exceptions the operator recorded during check-in.

conditions: Phase is invoked from the Action List
Materials with Check-In Flag = Yes are present in the grid

preconditions: Recipe author has added a Check In Material phase and configured Instructions, selected BOM materials and their flags, and set ConfirmationType.
Materials are staged in the system and flagged for check-in.
postconditions: Selected materials have been checked in and allocated to the unit procedure.
side_effects: May call the Exception page if the operator records any material-related exceptions.
example_usage: An author configures a Check In Material phase with Instructions = 'Check in raw materials', selects BOM items RM-01 and RM-02, enables Allow Overage on RM-02, marks RM-01 as Require Minimum, leaves No Quantity unchecked, and sets ConfirmationType = 'Single'. At runtime, the operator checks both items, confirms overage for RM-02, then clicks Finish and signs off to complete the check-in.
